awd_titl_txt: Evaluation of a General Sliding Law by Flow Simulation,     Haut Glacier D'Arolla, Switzerland
awd_abstract_narration: 9321350  Harbor  This award is for support for a project to use a finite element  model for cross-sectional flow to constrain sliding and flow laws  for the Haut Glacier d'Arolla (Switzerland).  By varying sliding  law exponents, the piezometric surface form and position, and the  pattern of basil friction it will be possible to constrain the  range of conditions that yields velocity fields consistent with  empirical data.  This work takes advantage of a unique chance to  test and refine the general sliding law, and an opportunity to  explicitly examine spatial variations in sliding in the context of  detailed information on the temporal and spatial development of the  glacier's hydrologic system.  Although this work will be based on  data collected in a mid-latitude alpine area, the results will be  of direct relevance to polar glaciology because they can also be  applied to glaciers with temperate (warm based) areas in polar  regions.  ***
